Episodes.Title: Commander Pierce
Episodes.Writer: Ronny Graham, Don Segall, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Pierce is temporarily put in charge of the 4077th, the weight of the responsibility takes its toll. He changes, becoming up-tight and authoritarian.

Episodes.Title: Peace on Us
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When the Army increases the number of points needed for a discharge, Hawkeye gets angry and interrupts official peace talks. Meanwhile, Margaret decides to divorce Donald after he permanently transfers himself stateside.

Episodes.Title: Lil
Episodes.Writer: Sheldon Bull, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Radar gets bent out of shape when he thinks Colonel Potter is spending too much time with a visiting female colonel, and Hawkeye tries to figure out what BJ's initials stand for.

Episodes.Title: Our Finest Hour
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: An hour-long series retrospective. A reporter, Clete Roberts, interviews the staff. Mixed in are scenes from past shows.

Episodes.Title: The Billfold Syndrome
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Major Winchester decides to quit talking to everyone at the camp, which Hawkeye and B.J. take as a challenge. Meanwhile, a medic gets amnesia.

Episodes.Title: None Like It Hot
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Johnny Bonaduce
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A bath tub Hawkeye and B.J. purchase during a heat wave instantly becomes the ultimate hot spot, while Radar prepares for a tonsillectomy.

Episodes.Title: They Call the Wind Korea
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: During a wind storm, and while lost on the way to Seoul, Winchester and Klinger come across an overturned Greek transport with several injured men.

Episodes.Title: Major Ego
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Major Winchester lets his surgical prowess go to his head when a "Stars and Stripes" journalist comes to interview him. But the journalist is more interested in making moves on Margaret than getting the story.

Episodes.Title: Baby, It's Cold Outside
Episodes.Writer: Gary David Goldberg, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077th is forced to use extreme measures to save a group of soldiers suffering from hypothermia, while Klinger suffers temporary deafness after a mine explosion on his watch.

Episodes.Title: Point of View
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A wounded soldier being treated at the 4077th provides a narrative through his eyes.

Episodes.Title: Dear Comrade
Episodes.Writer: Tom Reeder, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A North Korean Spy infiltrates the 4077 and poses as Charles' houseboy, to observe and report on 4077th's efficiency and success to his superiors. The staff is baffled by a skin-rash epidemic.

Episodes.Title: Out of Gas
Episodes.Writer: Tom Reeder, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When the camp copes with a critical shortage of sodium pentathol, a vital anesthetic, Father Mulcahy must use his black market contacts to get some.

Episodes.Title: An Eye for a Tooth
Episodes.Writer: Ronny Graham, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Winchester encourages Hawkeye, B.J. and Margaret to raise the stakes in their practical joke battle, and Father Mulcahy is desperate to receive a promotion.

Episodes.Title: Dear Sis
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: It's Christmas time in Korea, and everybody's depressed--especially Father Mulcahy, who is concerned that he isn't making a difference to anyone.

Episodes.Title: B. J. Papa San
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. helps out a local Korean family. Meanwhile, a general has a series of mishaps in camp.

Episodes.Title: Inga
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye falls for a visiting Swedish doctor, but is disconcerted by her take-charge ways. As a result, he is forced to confront his chauvinistic views toward powerful women.

Episodes.Title: The Price
Episodes.Writer: Erik Tarloff, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Klinger tries to bribe Colonel Potter, but Potter is more concerned with the disappearance of his horse, Sophie. Meanwhile, Hawkeye and B.J. try to hide a man who is about to be drafted into the Korean army.

Episodes.Title: The Young and the Restless
Episodes.Writer: Mitch Markowitz, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The arrival of fresh-faced lecturer Capt. Simmons and his subsequent performance in ER turns Winchester into a drunk, Potter into an invalid, and BJ into a bookworm. Meanwhile, Klinger begins acting like he's back home in Toledo.

Episodes.Title: Hot Lips Is Back in Town
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Bernard Dilbert, Gary Markowitz
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Margaret celebrates her newly obtained divorce by creating a new way to handle triage and invites a general to observe. Radar is enamored of a new nurse and tries everything he knows to get her attention.

Episodes.Title: C*A*V*E
Episodes.Writer: Larry Balmagia, Ronny Graham, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A hurried relocation to a cave is complicated by Hawkeye revealing he has claustrophobia.

Episodes.Title: Rally 'Round the Flagg, Boys
Episodes.Writer: Mitch Markowitz, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A patient accuses Hawkeye of being a Communist sympathizer when he operates on a Korean soldier ahead of an American. As a result, Colonel Flagg attempts to recruit Winchester to spy on Hawkeye.

Episodes.Title: Preventative Medicine
Episodes.Writer: Tom Reeder, Larry Balmagia, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye performs a shocking and sinister stunt to keep a war-obsessed colonel from sending more young victims to a possible early grave, while Klinger tries to use voodoo on Potter to get a discharge.

Episodes.Title: A Night at Rosie's
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: In an act of protest, Hawkeye goes to Rosie's Bar and decrees that he will not leave. One by one he is joined by fellow surgeons and staff, including an annoyed Colonel Potter.

Episodes.Title: Ain't Love Grand
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: While B.J. and Hawkeye snipe at each other, Klinger romances a nurse and Winchester romances a Korean working girl.

Episodes.Title: The Party
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Burt Metcalfe, Larry Balmagia
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Even while the camp is bugging out (and back), B.J. promotes the idea of a stateside "reunion" for the families of those at the 4077th.
